conclusion: To find the kinetic energy of the electron at point C, analyze the motion of the electron in the electric field and use the given information about its velocity and angle.
Calculate initial kinetic energy Ki using formula Ki = 1/2 m v0^2.
At point C, the velocity of the electron makes a 30° angle with the initial direction.
Horizontal component of velocity remains unchanged: vx = v0 = 4 × 10^6 m/s.
Vertical component of velocity is vy = v sin(30°) = v/2.
Use Pythagorean theorem for velocity components: v^2 = vx^2 + vy^2.
Calculate final kinetic energy Kf using formula Kf = 1/2 m v^2.
The kinetic energy of the electron at point C is 9.73 × 10^-18 J.
